title: MAG 078 - Distant Cousin Transcript
text:
(RECORDING) 
It’s just a scratch, John. I’ll be fine. Can we begin? 
ARCHIVIST 
Was there anything I could have done? Could I have… 
[The sounds of the cassette tape] 

The Magnus Archives – MAG078 – Distant Cousin 
11 
 
SASHA (RECORDING) 
Hello? I see you. Show yourself. 
[The sounds of the cassette tape] 
NOT!SASHA (RECORDING) 
Hello? 
[The sounds of the cassette tape] 
I see you. 
[The sounds of the cassette tape] 
I see you. 
ARCHIVIST 
And now I see you. 
[Tape clicks off. Tape clicks on.] 
TIM 
You wanted to see us. 
MARTIN 
Are you ok? You look awful. 
ARCHIVIST 
I’m… I’m coming down with something, I think. Listen, you should take the rest 
of the day off. Tomorrow as well. 
MARTIN 

The Magnus Archives – MAG078 – Distant Cousin 
12 
 
Are you sure you – 
ARCHIVIST 
Don’t want to infect anyone else. Best you stay home. 
TIM 
Wouldn’t it make more sense if you went home, then? 
MARTIN 
Are you feverish? We should probably get you to a doctor. Look, there’s a 
walk-in centre nearby I can – 
ARCHIVIST 
No. No, I have things I still need to take care of here. And, besides, I know 
you’ve both been under a lot of… pressure lately. I think we could all do with a 
bit of break. 
MARTIN 
Well… well, yeah but… 
ARCHIVIST 
I know, I know, a lot of it’s been because of me. Most of it. I’m sorry. Tim, I 
know things have been… fraught. 
TIM 
I guess that’s a word for it. 
ARCHIVIST 
Yes, well, I think some time off could only help. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG078 – Distant Cousin 
13 
 
TIM 
Because you’re ill. 
ARCHIVIST 
Yes…. Yes. And I’m… I’m sorry. About everything. 
MARTIN 
J-John… look, are you – 
TIM 
Ok. Right you are, John. We’ll be going. 
MARTIN 
Wait, what? 
TIM 
Come on, Martin. We could do with a break. Er… do you need us to tell Sasha? 
ARCHIVIST 
Oh, no, no. I’ll be seeing her later. 
MARTIN 
Tim… Wait… 
TIM 
Great. See you Monday. 
MARTIN 
No, no… 

The Magnus Archives – MAG078 – Distant Cousin 
14 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Yes, see you then. 
MARTIN 
Hang on, Tim, we should probably – 
[The office door closes. The tape clicks off. The tape clicks on.] 
ARCHIVIST 
(Whispered) It is remarkably easy to buy an axe in Central London. Harder to 
sneak it into Artefact Storage, but not impossible. I don’t know if destroying 
this is going to kill that thing… but I am damn sure it’s going to hurt. 
[The axe hits the wood of the table. The Archivist grunts with the effort as 
the wood splinters.] 
Hollow. Just cobwebs and dust. 
(Michael laughs) 
MICHAEL 
That was very stupid. 
ARCHIVIST 
What do you want? 
MICHAEL 
There’s no other way out of this room, you know. 
ARCHIVIST 

The Magnus Archives – MAG078 – Distant Cousin 
15 
 
What? 
MICHAEL 
You don’t have time to escape before they get here. 
ARCHIVIST 
The… the… the “Not Sasha”? No, but the table… 
MICHAEL 
Was binding it quite effectively. 
ARCHIVIST 
Oh. Oh no. 
MICHAEL 
Even with all the protections you have on, I doubt you can survive them now. 
ARCHIVIST 
(Quietly) No, no, no 
NOT!SASHA 
(Quietly as if far away. Her voice sounds even stranger than usual) 
Jooooohhhnnnn…. 
ARCHIVIST 
Er… I… 
[A door opens] 
MICHAEL
